title: Christian Atsu Still Missing After Turkey Earthquake Despite Reports, Club Says
description: It was unclear whether Mr. Atsu, a Ghanaian national, was still trapped underneath the rubble in Hatay Province, Turkey, or whether he had been removed but could not be located in the region’s overwhelmed hospitals.

title: Why the Odds Are Stacked Against a Promising New Covid Drug
description: A new drug quashes all coronavirus variants. But regulatory hurdles and a lack of funding make it unlikely to reach the U.S. market anytime soon.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Frustration Mounts in Turkey
description: Also, Volodymyr Zelensky visits Britain and LeBron James breaks a record.

title: Greece Moves to Block Extreme-Right Party as Election Nears
description: A new law targets a party founded by an imprisoned former official of the neo-Nazi group Golden Dawn. But critics say its reach could be wider.

title: 2 Children Killed After Bus Driver Crashes Into Day Care Near Montreal
description: The police in Laval, Quebec, said that six other children were injured and that the driver had been charged with murder.

title: Turks and Syrians Abroad Rally to Help Their Homelands After Earthquake
description: An outpouring of donations is flowing from around the world, as communities struggle to ease feelings of helplessness — and the agony of waiting for loved ones who have not called.

title: China Sends Spy Balloons Over Military Sites Worldwide, U.S. Officials Say
description: The balloons have some advantages over the satellites that orbit the earth in regular patterns. They fly closer to earth and can evade radar.

title: Lost Letters by Mary, Queen of Scots, Uncovered by Code Breakers
description: The messages, written while she was imprisoned by her cousin Queen Elizabeth I, were mistakenly listed as Italian texts in France’s national library.

title: Putin Likely Approved Missile System Used to Down Flight MH17, Inquiry Says
description: A Dutch-led team said it had suspended its investigation because of insufficient evidence and rules that prevent new prosecutions.

title: Élisabeth Borne, France’s Prime Minister, on Her Harrowing Story
description: The daughter of an Auschwitz survivor, Élisabeth Borne has avoided bringing her past into politics, even when it might be appropriate.

title: ‘Troubling’ Race Disparity Is Found in U.K. Prosecution Decisions
description: Black and biracial people in England and Wales are significantly more likely be prosecuted than white people who have been arrested on comparable charges, according to a major study.

title: What’s a Japanese Mobster to Do in Retirement? Join a Softball Team.
description: The members of the Ryuyukai have done nearly 100 years of hard time. Now they’re just looking to stay out of trouble.

title: Twitter Is Blocked in Turkey After Earthquake, Internet-Monitoring Group Says
description: The service was blocked in what appeared to be a coordinated way.

title: Zelensky thanks Britain during his second overseas trip since Russia’s invasion.
Zelensky Arrives in U.K. on Rare Overseas Trip
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine will address Britain’s Parliament in a visit to a critical ally in his nation’s war effort.

title: Live Updates: Quake Death Toll Passes 11,000 in Turkey and Syria
description: The death toll from the devastating earthquake in Turkey and Syria rose as rescuers faced shortages of trucks, fuel and time. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey visited the area near the epicenter.

title: State of Uncertainty
description: What Biden said, and didn’t, in his State of the Union speech.

title: In Rural Ukraine, a Mobile Clinic Provides Medicine and Hope
description: A mobile clinic is trying to restore medical services to villages once occupied by Russian forces as fighting rages nearby. “They’ll never beat our people,” a specialist with the team said.

title: China’s Bid to Improve Food Production? Giant Towers of Pigs.
description: High-rise hog farms have sprung up nationwide as part of Beijing’s drive to enhance its agricultural competitiveness and reduce its dependence on imports.

title: Syrian Refugees Who Died in Turkey Earthquake Are Returned Home
description: “Those who died, we want them to come back,” said Ahmad Yousef, who was waiting to receive the body of a cousin’s daughter. “We want them to be buried among their family.”

title: Grieving Turkish Diaspora Rallies to Support Turkey Earthquake Victims
description: In Melbourne, Australia, dozens of volunteers in the parking lot behind a halal butcher shop packed three shipping containers with cardboard boxes full of new tents, blankets and sleeping bags.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: The rising death toll in Turkey and Syria from the earthquake.

title: Biden Focuses on Domestic Issues in State of the Union Despite Global Tensions
description: Mr. Biden is proud of reshaping foreign policy to focus on superpower conflict, but knows it is jobs and energy prices that voters want to hear about.

title: Videos Show Desperate Search for Survivors Near Quake’s Epicenter in Turkey
description: Hatay Province had Turkey’s highest-known death toll from Monday’s earthquake.

title: After Spy Balloon Clash, U.S.-China Tensions Loom Over Biden’s Speech
description: The president has taken steps meant to limit China’s technological advancement and bolster military forces in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Baby Born in Rubble of Turkey-Syria Earthquake is one of Many Child Victims
description: Harrowing images have emerged of some of the millions of children caught in the catastrophic earthquake in Turkey and Syria.
